title: How to Clean and Brush a Designafriend's Hair

steps.headline: Remove your DesignaFriend's clothing carefully.
steps.description: Don't forget to remove any accessories.

steps.headline: Fill a basin (sink) with warm or lukewarm water.
Wrap your doll in a clean, small hand-towel.
Lean your doll over the sink, facing upwards.
steps.description: Tilt your doll so her hair is dipped is fully dipped into the water.

steps.headline: Place your doll on a flat surface near the sink.
Squirt a small amount of either into your hands:
steps.description: Baby Shampoo Wig Shampoo Mild Shampoo

steps.headline: Clasp your hands together.
steps.description: Then, begin to rub the shampoo into your dolls hair.

steps.headline: Dip your doll's hair into the water in the basin.
steps.description: Finger comb the hair, to ensure it's clean.

steps.headline: Place your doll again onto the the same surface.
Take a very small amount of conditioner.
Start working the conditioner through your doll's hair.
steps.description: You may work the conditioner from mid-length of her hair or all the way downwards.

steps.headline: Dip your doll's hair into the basin once again.
steps.description: Continue finger combing her hair, ensuring your doll's hair is clean.

steps.headline: Wrap your dolls hair in another hand-towel.
Take the plug out of the sink.
Let your doll's hair dry until it is fully dried or slightly damp.
Sit your doll between your legs.
steps.description: Cover her with a clean washcloth or hand-towel before you start.

steps.headline: Dampen your doll's hair with a sponge or a misting bottle.
steps.description: If you have already washed your doll's hair, and left it slightly damp, you do not need to dampen/mist your doll's hair.

steps.headline: Take a small hair grip and pin up the top layer of your doll's hair.
Brush your dolls hair.
steps.description: Start at at the top and brush down to the tips. Mist or dampen your doll's hair occasionally if needed to remove knots for example.

text: Washing the Doll Hair Remove your DesignaFriend's clothing carefully. Don't forget to remove any accessories. Fill a basin (sink) with warm or lukewarm water.  Wrap your doll in a clean, small hand-towel.  Lean your doll over the sink, facing upwards. Tilt your doll so her hair is dipped is fully dipped into the water. Place your doll on a flat surface near the sink.  Squirt a small amount of either into your hands: Baby Shampoo Wig Shampoo Mild Shampoo Clasp your hands together. Then, begin to rub the shampoo into your dolls hair. Dip your doll's hair into the water in the basin. Finger comb the hair, to ensure it's clean. Place your doll again onto the the same surface.  Take a very small amount of conditioner. Rub your hands together. Start working the conditioner through your doll's hair. You may work the conditioner from mid-length of her hair or all the way downwards. Dip your doll's hair into the basin once again. Continue finger combing her hair, ensuring your doll's hair is clean. Wrap your dolls hair in another hand-towel.  Take the plug out of the sink.  Let your doll's hair dry until it is fully dried or slightly damp.  Combing the Doll Hair Sit your doll between your legs. Cover her with a clean washcloth or hand-towel before you start. Dampen your doll's hair with a sponge or a misting bottle. If you have already washed your doll's hair, and left it slightly damp, you do not need to dampen/mist your doll's hair. Take a small hair grip and pin up the top layer of your doll's hair.  Brush your dolls hair. Start at at the top and brush down to the tips. Mist or dampen your doll's hair occasionally if needed to remove knots for example.
